Darwin spent so much time with Professor Henslow that his Cambridge peers dubbed him “the man who walks with Henslow”.

Through Professor Henslow,

Darwin was introduced to many older famous people.

Sedgwick,

next time you go

on a geology field trip,

take Charles along.

He’s got quite an interest

in geology.

Of course,

he’s welcome

anytime.

When he was not spending time with Professor Henslow, Darwin went out with William to collect

ground beetles.

Aha!

There’s one!

Wow, there’s

a Crucifix Ground

Beetle!

But I’ve got to put these somewhere first…

41
